explanation: Funds are required for the reset (to include the non-recurring engineering, build, and test to mitigate obsolescence issues) of the Wide Area Airborne Surveillance (WAAS) sensors for the Enhanced Medium Altitude Reconnaissance and Surveillance System — Geospatial Intelligence (EMARSS-G) fixed wing aircraft. The current sensors have obsolescence issues that are projected to degrade the WAAS capability in the FY 2019 timeframe due to obsolete components. This effort will result in an ability to continue to execute deployed missions without readiness degradation and will extend the usable life of the current sensor system for approximately 10 additional years. This is a MIP project. This is a base budget requirement.

Funds are required to procure four Gray Eagle unmanned aircraft to replace aircraft lost in Operation FREEDOM’S SENTINEL. A total of $30.3 million is being requested for the four aircraft; the other $7.721 million is requested in Part IV of this reprogramming. These aircraft will be in the standard range configuration in support of Combat Aviation Brigade operations. The funds requested include the aircraft and associated government furnished equipment. This request accounts for all remaining war losses to date and brings the program back to a full complement of aircraft to include planned attrition aircraft. This is a MIP project. This is an OCO budget requirement.

Funds are required to procure and install hardware to upgrade Multi-Protocol Label Switching (MPLS) equipment. The MPLS is part of a modernization effort to upgrade the bandwidth capacity of the Defense Information System Network (DISN). It is also the industry-standard, Joint Regional Security Stack (JRSS) enabling technology that enhances the speed of manages network traffic flow. Specifically, funds are required to procure routers and switches which will be installed at JRSS locations DoD-wide.

Funds are available due to a change in aircraft platform integration requirements for the Improved Data Modem which resulted in a schedule slip. The requirements will now be funded with Aircraft Procurement Army, 16/18, funds. This is base budget funding.
